analysis.summary: Niagara Falls Water Board is soliciting proposals from qualified engineering consultants to perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) work in specified LaSalle area sewersheds, produce an NYSDEC-compliant engineering report and corrective action plan for I&I reduction, and conduct post-construction monitoring, with optional pricing for Phases 2 and 3. The work is partially funded by a New York State Engineering Planning Grant and must comply with associated state financial assistance, MWBE/SDVOB, EEO, and reporting requirements.

requirements.description: Perform Phase 1 SSES work in the 91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1 sewersheds, covering 3.0 and 1.8 miles of sanitary main pipe respectively, as defined in Tasks 1–8.

Provide option prices, schedules, and scopes to perform applicable SSES tasks for Phase 2 (81st & Frontier 2; 80th & Lindbergh sewersheds) and Phase 3 (Mang & 88th sewershed) as described, recognizing NFWB may award later at its discretion.
Identify a Project Manager to serve as primary contact and lead project management and support activities.
Review existing data, records, reports, the applicable Order on Consent, and NYSDEC correspondence related to LaSalle SSO abatement.
Gain familiarity with the Phase 1 sewersheds, system context, and history of I&I reduction, sewer repair, maintenance, and flow management (including SCADA-controlled lift stations).
Meet with Water Board staff to discuss scope, understand dry and wet weather system response, and obtain input on locations for flow isolation and measurement.
Consult with and advise NFWB staff throughout the engagement and meet with NFWB and NYSDEC as needed to reach consensus on work and corrective actions.
Provide all staff, equipment, and materials needed to conduct smoke testing in Phase 1 sewersheds.
Notify residents 2–4 days in advance of smoke testing with hand-delivered door hangers and assist NFWB in preparing a press release; coordinate notice to police and fire officials.
Conduct smoke testing during appropriate weather conditions and document and photograph defects identified.
Review prior flow measurement and analysis for relevant sewersheds before performing night-time weiring flow isolation and measurement.
Select adequate locations and number of weirs and measurements to allow complete and accurate infiltration analysis and sufficiently detailed I&I corrective actions, in consultation with NFWB staff.
Provide all staff, equipment, materials, and traffic control for flow isolation and measurement; ensure staff have appropriate confined space entry training and equipment.
Notify residents 2–4 days ahead of disruptive night-time weiring work with hand-delivered door hangers and assist NFWB with a press release.
Analyze flow data and calculate infiltration in gallons per day per linear foot of sewer main for each weiring section.
Analyze and summarize available CCTV inspection reports and manhole inspection reports prepared by NFWB staff, and perform additional data collection as required.
Meet with NFWB personnel to review repairs made after CCTV/manhole inspections and use NFWB-provided recorded CCTV footage and additional imaging as needed.
Review available information on two Phase 1 outfalls (structure dimensions, estimated SSO volumes, inspection reports, discharge configuration).
Conduct site visits to SSO/outfall locations to document existing conditions and confirm record information, with NFWB assistance for locating.
Develop a recommended Work Plan for assessing Outfall/SSO locations, potentially including flow meters, rain gauges, confined space entry, dye testing, and coordinated CCTV inspections.
Upon NFWB authorization, execute the Outfall/SSO assessment Work Plan and document findings in GIS-compatible format with recommendations to reduce extraneous flows.
Conduct focused SSES (dye testing, house inspections, and additional CCTV via NFWB crews) in areas identified as I&I sources, as needed to locate or confirm I&I sources.
Include a $10,000 contingency for Task 6 (Focused SSES/other unforeseen necessary work) in the proposal, to be used only with NFWB approval.

Perform SSES in a manner satisfactory to NYSDEC and prepare an SSES report for NYSDEC identifying I&I sources in Phase 1 sewersheds and a corrective action plan for cost-effective I&I reduction, including budgetary costs and implementation timelines.
Complete the SSES report on a schedule that allows NYSDEC review early in 2023, supporting potential construction in 2023–early 2024 and post-construction monitoring by June 2024.

Ensure the SSES report is prepared, stamped, and dated by a NYS-licensed Professional Engineer and conforms to the Engineering Report Outline for NYS Wastewater Infrastructure Projects (October 1, 2022).
Conduct post-construction monitoring in 2024 of sewer improvements completed in 2023 in Phase 1 sewersheds, including I&I assessment of pre-/post-construction flows and rainfall.
Prepare a Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC documenting I&I reduction and most effective reduction techniques.

Include in the proposal: situation understanding, understanding of applicable regulations and standards, project approach, scope, and organization, demonstrated similar project experience, experience/qualifications of subconsultants, and specific experience of key professionals.
Provide schedule, effort, and budget breakdown: schedule as bar chart, effort and budget as task/hour estimate matrix with not-to-exceed fee, plus $10,000 contingency for Task 6.

Complete and return all forms in Appendix E (standard terms, conditions, and required forms) with the proposal, including non-collusion, lobbying law disclosure, EEO policy, sexual harassment statement, and RFP acknowledgement and certification.
Submit MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or properly completed waiver requests with the proposal, consistent with Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions (Appendix F).
Meet MWBE combined participation goal of 30% (MBE/WBE) and SDVOB participation goal of 6% or demonstrate good-faith efforts and obtain waivers as allowed.
Submit EEO Staffing Plan and Workforce Employment Utilization Reports as required by the EPG terms and conditions.

Comply with all Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions for Non-Construction contracts funded with NYS financial assistance (Appendix F), including MWBE/SDVOB, EEO, suspension/debarment, and reporting requirements.
Submit a statement of qualifications describing business structure, licensing, years in business, similar experience (with references), locations, key personnel, and other relevant qualifications.

Disclose in the statement of qualifications: other names used in past 10 years, subsidiaries/parents, any debarment/suspension, responsibility findings, defaults/terminations, liquidated damages, bankruptcies, legal actions/investigations, and any fraud/collusion/bribery-related matters.
Disclose any potential conflicts of interest and plans to resolve them.

If subcontractors/subconsultants will perform more than 10% of the work, provide their identity, qualifications, business structure, experience, and key personnel resumes/contact info and prior relevant experience.

Deliver one clearly marked original and six copies of the proposal package plus one electronic copy on CD or USB drive, preferably as a single PDF converted from source files, by the stated deadline and location.
Ensure sealed outer envelope is addressed to the Water Board contact, clearly indicates proposer’s name and address, and is clearly marked with the RFP number and title.
Acknowledge all addenda received using Appendix E Form No. 1; verify with authorized contact that all addenda have been received prior to submission.
Certify non-collusion via Appendix E Form No. 2, with notarization.
Complete Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement (Appendix E Form No. 3), including disclosure of any prior non-responsibility determinations and terminations/withholdings, with notarization.
Submit signed EEO Policy Statement and Agreement (Appendix E Form No. 4).
Submit Statement on Sexual Harassment pursuant to State Finance Law §139-l (Appendix E Form No. 5), with notarization.
Submit Appendix E Form No. 6 (RFP Acknowledgement and Certification), acknowledging the proposal as a firm offer and agreeing to RFP terms, with notarization.
Agree that the proposal is firm and irrevocable for 90 days from the submission deadline unless extended by addendum.

Maintain required insurance coverages (Workers’ Compensation, Disability, Employer’s Liability, CGL, Auto, Umbrella/Excess, and Professional Liability) with specified limits and name NFWB, Niagara Falls Public Water Authority, and City of Niagara Falls as additional insureds where required.
Pay prevailing wages as required by law and submit Workforce Employment Utilization Reports if required by Executive Law and Executive Order 162.
Implement and maintain a written sexual harassment prevention policy and provide annual training to all employees, as required by NY Labor Law §201-g.
Certify compliance with Iran Divestment Act, international boycott prohibition, MacBride Principles, prohibition on purchase of tropical hardwoods, and other statutory certifications in Appendix E.

Agree to non-discrimination, FOIL-related handling of confidential information, records retention for at least six years, breach notification and data security laws, and all other standard terms in Appendix E.
Attend the mandatory pre-proposal information session at the Wastewater Treatment Plant on the specified date and time.
Submit any written questions by the stated deadline to the authorized Water Board contact via email with appropriate subject line.
Limit communications during the Restricted Period to the designated Water Board contact in compliance with State Finance Law §§139-j and 139-k.

Provide adequate and competent personnel with necessary licensing, education, training, and experience, and ensure compliance with credentialing, security, safety, and site-specific safety plan requirements as requested.
Coordinate and cooperate with other contractors and third parties on NFWB property as needed to ensure service delivery.
Provide monthly invoices with sufficient supporting documentation; comply with MWBE/SDVOB and prevailing wage reporting to receive payment.
Recognize that the contract may be terminated for cause, convenience, or violations of lobbying law provisions as detailed in Appendix E.

key_differentiators: Deep situational understanding of LaSalle SSO history, NYSDEC Order on Consent, and R-value methodology, reflected in a tailored SSES and monitoring strategy.

Demonstrated, recent experience delivering SSES, I&I mitigation, and NYSDEC/EFC-funded wastewater projects in New York, including preparation of Engineering Report Outline-compliant reports stamped by NY-licensed PEs.
A clear, efficient, and realistic schedule that aligns with early 2023 NYSDEC review, 2023–early 2024 construction, and completion of post-construction monitoring by June 2024.

Innovative yet proven approaches to flow monitoring, data analytics, GIS integration, and prioritization of cost-effective I&I reduction measures, including robust post-construction performance evaluation.
Strong project management structure with an experienced Project Manager, clear communication plan with NFWB/NYSDEC, and proactive stakeholder coordination (residents, public safety agencies).

Robust plan to meet or exceed MWBE (30%) and SDVOB (6%) participation goals, with identified certified partners and clear utilization strategies, minimizing risk of non-compliance or liquidated damages.
Comprehensive safety, confined space entry, and quality assurance programs that reduce operational risk during field activities (night-time weiring, smoke testing, dye testing, house inspections).
Well-structured cost proposal with transparent task/hour estimates, clear not-to-exceed fee, and sensible use of the $10,000 contingency focused on high-value focused SSES activities.
Ability to seamlessly extend to Phases 2 and 3 with consistent methods, tools, and team continuity, offering economies of scale and reduced learning curve for NFWB.
